storyInfo: A Catastrophe Messenger visits the anchored Rhodes Island, delivering news that a Catastrophe will strike the area in three to five days. He then approaches GreyThroat and makes her an unexpected offer.

attributes.text: I am dreaming.
In the dream, it is the day my mother first brought me to Rhodes Island. She took me, a young child, to the huge landship to meet one person after another.
Their faces are blurry, their voices distant.
I had a feeling that my mother had made an important decision.
I was too young at the time. I naively thought that nothing short of death could separate me from my mother.
Until an adult led me away, while my mother stood there and watched.
I turned around to look at her, but I couldn't discern the emotions in her eyes.

attributes.content: So, uhh, GreyThroat... Is that what you go by now?
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: That's right. And you are?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Umm... Do you really not recognize me?
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Sir, you're bringing news of a Catastrophe. Though the situation isn't particularly urgent, I don't think we have time to play guessing games with one another.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Fair enough. After all, it's been so many years, and you were still so young back then.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Here, this is a photo I took with your parents. Does it jog your memory?
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: In the photo, the man in front of me looks as old as I am now. He stands next to my mother and father with his arms folded. There's a date in the lower right corner, and it's not long after my eighth birthday.
There are a few words written on the back of the photo: 'For Ian Caldwell.'
Ian Caldwell... My father's student. I remember you. You used to stop by our house often.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Righto. That's me.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: You've changed an awful lot.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: So what should I call you? GreyThroat, or...
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: GreyThroat's fine.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Sounds good. Anyway, I'm here for one other thing, besides warning you about the Catastrophe.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: I'd like you to be my bodyguard.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Leaving Rhodes Island to be... your bodyguard? That's unrealistic.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: And even if you were my father's student, why did it take you so many years to find Rhodes Island and me?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: I only ran into you again a few months ago, during the Catastrophe that struck the Winterwisp Mountains in the north of Leithanien.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: ...In Wolumonde?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Right, the Catastrophe that tore through Wolumonde. Had it not been for you and your team, things could've gone a whole lot worse.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Unfortunately, you were already evacuating when I saw you, and I was rushing to the scene. You looked familiar, but I didn't have time to actually confirm it was you.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: After that, I found out from the Catastrophe Messenger information network that it really was you.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: And what does that have to do with me becoming your bodyguard?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: You weren't this distrustful when you were a kid. Have they been... treating you alright on Rhodes Island all these years?
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Your mother... I met her after the incident that took my teacher's life. She was looking everywhere for a place where you would be taken care of.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: And she came to you?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: The other way around. I offered to take care of you and your mother for a while, but she turned me down.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: She did? Why?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Maybe because I could barely support myself at the time.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Your parents treated me well, even letting me stay at your place for a while. So, I've always felt bad about what happened.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Also... I've seen how you interact with the Infected.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: You rescued an Infected somewhere near the Winterwisp Mountains outside of Wolumonde.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Something like that should have been a piece of cake for Rhodes Island, but when you were helping the Infected—
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger
Blaze
attributes.content: Heyo—

attributes.name: Blaze
attributes.content: Oh, are you chatting with a guest?
attributes.joined: Heyo—Oh, are you chatting with a guest?

attributes.content: Just about done. What's up?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Who's this?
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Blaze, Rhodes Island elite operator. Blaze, this is Ian, one of my father's students.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Blaze saunters over off-handedly and leans against the wall.
Umm...
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: According to our estimates, a Catastrophe will hit in roughly three to five days. I'll be staying in the area for about a day or two.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: If you've made up your mind, come and see me. I'll be staying in a town slightly north of where Rhodes Island is anchored.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Sorry for interrupting.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: You don't seem sorry at all.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Oh, really?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: C'mon, don't be all stony-faced like that. You're still young, y'know. You won't get wrinkles by having more expressions.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: ...What on earth brings you here?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: There's a party on the deck tomorrow night. Wanna come?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Oh wow, this is rare. You're actually considering it?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I thought you'd blow me off like usual and say, 'I'm not going anywhere with you.'
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: And each time, you'd come over five minutes before the party started and drag me there anyway.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: See, you get it after all.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Or, are you hesitating... because you've decided to accept Ian's offer?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: For the record, I just happened to overhear your conversation when I came in. Wasn't trying to eavesdrop or anything, sorry.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Don't worry about it.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Because I seem more genuinely sorry this time?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Something like that.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Jokes aside, what do you think about his offer?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: There's no way I'll accept it, but I should at least have a talk with him.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: When is Rhodes Island leaving?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Seeing how the Catastrophe alert puts us at risk in about three to five days, we're probably setting off in the next twenty-four hours.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: No worries though, there's enough time. Even if your chat with the dude takes longer than expected, I'll buy you some time by talking the engine guy into having a few drinks in the boiler room.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Glad you decided to come, GreyThroat.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Want something to drink? The townspeople are preparing to evacuate, so everything's cheap right now.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: ...I'll pass.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Let's circle back to our conversation about my mother. Did she leave anything behind, or... did you learn anything about her during your time as a Messenger?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: ...Unfortunately, no.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: I tried looking for her but with no success. That said, I could search more efficiently with you as my bodyguard.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: I still don't get it.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: I understand why you're looking for a bodyguard. Maybe your old one has resigned or passed away. Whatever the case, you urgently need a new one now.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: But why me? Because of the rescue mission in Wolumonde? Or because you want to help me out and make up for what you couldn't do for me in the past?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: If you insist on putting it that way, then yes, I'd like to help you.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Remember what I never got to finish saying on Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: While you were helping that Infected man back in the Winterwisp Mountains, your hands were shaking the whole time, and your whole body was... emanating terror.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: I knew in that instant that... we were exactly the same.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: How so?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Have you never wondered why I'm a Catastrophe Messenger now when I used to be your father's student?
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Because I also lost a few of my kin in the unrest that took your father's life...
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: From then on, I'll feel nauseous whenever I see those hideous Originium crystals in the flesh beneath my scalpel.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Whenever I think of the Oripathy medicine in the bottles, I can't help but think we'd be better off investing resources in diseases that can be cured, rather than throwing them away at this incurable disease.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: You get along pretty well with that Blaze girl, right? But when she was leaning against the wall, you couldn't control your urge to shift away from her.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: ...It's just a subconscious reaction.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: I can tell, GreyThroat. You've been living an oppressive life all these years on Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: I hope you can find another place that suits you better. Stop forcing yourself to walk on a path you could have avoided.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: I was raised on Rhodes Island, Ian. I'm not enough of an ingrate to cast aside the Infected for such a petty reason.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: You'll still be helping them, just in a different way.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Helping people avoid Catastrophes by nipping the very source of infection in the bud. How is that not helping them?
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Sure, they might have raised you, but that doesn't mean you need to heed their orders forever. That's blind obedience, not gratitude.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: With their days numbered, the Infected have no choice but to cling onto a belief or hope. It doesn't matter whether they have to sacrifice or become violent for it.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: But the same can't be said for us. So, we don't have to adopt the same belief as them and force ourselves to live in a place where we're made to feel fear and hate.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Some not-so-distant memories are coming back to me.
Before I can weave those memories into words, a commotion suddenly comes from outside the window.
What's going on outside?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Seems like... a conflict has arisen during the evacuation process?
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: I'll go take a look.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Out of your responsibility as a Rhodes Island operator?
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: No, because it's the right thing to do.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: (*shrugs*) I'll tag along.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: What's going on here?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Over there... In the forest...
attributes.name: Frightened Townsperson

attributes.content: Is there a Catastrophe cloud?
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Sir, is the Catastrophe about to strike?
attributes.name: Frightened Townsperson

attributes.content: Don't panic. It's still pretty far away. I have a portable reader with me; just give me a moment...
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: It's coming sooner than expected, which is in six to twelve hours. It's still a storm.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Th-Then, what should we...
attributes.name: Frightened Townsperson

attributes.content: Evacuate immediately. Bring only essential items with you, as your safety is your top priority. Have you contacted the caravan? Can you reach them now?
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: No response from the caravan, but everyone here has a burdenbeast cart.
attributes.name: Frightened Townsperson

attributes.content: Forget the caravan and use your carts to evacuate the area first.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Yes! Thank you so much, sir!
attributes.name: Frightened Townsperson

attributes.content: GreyThroat, can you contact Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: ...No problem. I've already sent over a text.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Uwaah... Mom... Dad...
attributes.name: Terrified Child

attributes.content: Hold on, what's that child doing crying in the middle of town with not even an adult around?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: What's wrong, kiddo? Why are you crying?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Waaaah... uwaaah...
attributes.name: Terrified Child

attributes.content: Calm down, alright? Where are your parents?
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Uwh... Mom and Dad... They're... they're....
attributes.name: Terrified Child

attributes.content: I'm too scared to go back... Waaaah...
attributes.name: Terrified Child

attributes.content: Excuse me, do you know what's going on with this child?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: ...Isn't that one of those Infected kids from the woods? What're they doing here?
attributes.name: Nervous Townsperson

attributes.content: Alas, the Catastrophe cloud is coming soon, yet their parents don't even take care of them.
attributes.name: Nervous Townsperson

attributes.content: As soon as we hear the kid is an Infected, Ian and I step backward at the same time.
The child starts crying even louder.
The woods? What's that supposed to mean?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: The Infected here are driven out to the nearby woods. That's a relatively merciful way to handle them.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: The people inside those woods are...
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: I already sent someone over to notify them.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: People will naturally take action during times like these. They can see the Catastrophe clouds too, so they're not going to stick around, even without a warning.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: But they have no idea it could strike so soon. If they're delayed by a few hours...
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: I step forward and approach the terrified child again.
Hey, buddy... What are your parents doing right now?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Mom's bedridden... and Dad's outside finding herbs for her... Waaah...
attributes.name: Terrified Child

attributes.content: Do they have communicators with them?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Communi... caters?
attributes.name: Terrified Child

attributes.content: Something like this. It rings, and you can use it to talk to people nearby.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Terrified Child

attributes.content: Sir!
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: What is it? I'm busy!
attributes.name: Infected Townsperson

attributes.content: About this child's parents...
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: None of my business!
attributes.name: Infected Townsperson

attributes.content: We still have six to twelve hours before the Catastrophe strikes! This child's mother is bedridden and the father is out searching for herbs. Would you mind helping me notify them?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: You first said we had three to five days, but now it's become less than half a day. How can I be sure the Catastrophe won't come the moment I head to the woods?
attributes.name: Infected Townsperson

attributes.content: ...Ian, we need to notify the Infected left in the woods.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: The nearby Originium is already in the middle of activation. The closer you get to the eye of the Catastrophe, the more likely you'll be exposed to Active Originium dust.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Letting a healthy person walk toward a Catastrophe without any inhibitors and proper protective gear is tantamount to murder.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Besides... they're just some Infected, right?
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Ian, you...
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: We're exactly the same.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Hello? Blaze, you busy?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: That's right. I'm in the northern town. There's a group of Infected in the woods here who has no idea when the Catastrophe is going to strike. I need inhibitors and protective equipment, ASAP.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: ...What? Do you need to get the engine guy drunk?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Up to you, as long as it doesn't cause any delays. Over.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: You don't think Blaze is going to show up?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: You've been dealing with the Rhodes Island folks way longer than I have.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Indeed, some of the Infected do have a virtuous character, but only because they've always been that way.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: However, the Infected are generally a group of dying people.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: What lies at the core of their souls is despair. In order to survive, they'll become more violent, depraved, and unpredictable.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: That's why... you chose to step away and stop dealing with them.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: That's right. I chose to step away.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: I can accomplish a lot without dealing with them.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: I can still save a lot of lives from Catastrophes and prevent healthy people from becoming Infected. That's the choice I've made.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: 'It's all about saving more lives'?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: So, you're no stranger to our motto. Heard it in Wolumonde?
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Unfortunately, I'm not qualified to be a Contingency Contract Messenger yet.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Thank goodness for that.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: I don't agree with everything they do, but...
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: They're just trying to save more lives.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: What about the lives of the Infected?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: They, too, count as lives, but... their lives have been corrupted, so they are shorter and more dangerous. We must prioritize healthy people before them.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: You'd better not let Blaze hear you say that... No, don't you say that in front of me ever again.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: You mentioned 'blind obedience' just now.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Not too long ago, someone told me the same thing.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: If you only follow orders, if you rely on everyone else to tell you what to do, that can only end poorly.
attributes.name: Faust

attributes.content: How so?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Most of the sheep who blindly take orders aren't actually dependent on anyone. They just haven't started thinking for themselves...
attributes.name: Faust

attributes.content: And those who have no direction in life, they're just empty machines looking for a sense of accomplishment, and meaning.
attributes.name: Faust

attributes.content: You activate, and perform your function, you input a goal, you achieve your goal, until you consume everything around you, and you consume those you serve.
attributes.name: Faust

attributes.content: I'm not like that.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: You're inexperienced.
attributes.name: Faust

attributes.content: He was also an Infected, Ian. He wasn't even part of Rhodes Island, but an enemy.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: I'm not sure if I was blindly following orders back then, but now... I know exactly what I'm doing.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: I've spent years on Rhodes Island, groping around in the dark. No matter what, that's where my friends and the people important to me are. And among them are both ordinary people and Infected people.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Ian, aren't you also running away from the Infected?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: When we found out that child was infected, and when Blaze first walked into the room... you looked even more scared than I was.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Maybe we were the same at some point, but not anymore.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: At the very least, I no longer feel fear and hatred toward other people.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: I'm here!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: The inhibitors and protective gear.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Got 'em all here. Does this gentleman here need anything?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: No need. He's not going in.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: I see. Anything else you'd like to say to him?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Ian, if I came out of these woods infected... would you still want me to be your bodyguard?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: This is no laughing matter. You can't conceal your fear as your voice is trembling.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: That's right. I'm scared to death, but I'll never let it get the better of me.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Answer my question, Ian.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: The answer is no. If you got infected, I wouldn't want you as my bodyguard.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: I know this sounds harsh, but... nothing will change my attitude toward the Infected.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Even if you've never had a proper conversation with an Infected?
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: ...That's right.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: Alright. I guess there's nothing more to say.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Rhodes Island... has taught you well.
attributes.name: Catastrophe Messenger

attributes.content: I'll take that as a compliment.
attributes.name: GreyThroat

attributes.content: Wait, GreyThroat! Hold on!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.text: The child's parents lived on the outskirts of the forest. Upon hearing our warning, the haggard man carried his wife on his back and ran out of the woods.
Meanwhile, their child was still sitting in the town square, clutching their knees to their chest.
In the end, Blaze and I spent two hours spreading the news of the Catastrophe to every corner of the woods that could possibly provide shelter.
Four hours after Rhodes Island set sail, the Catastrophe struck the empty town and the woods.
By then, I was dozing off in the dorms, having completed the routine disinfection and check-up.
In the dream, it was the day my mother first brought me to Rhodes Island. She took me, a young child, to the huge landship to meet one person after another.

Amiya had an amicable vibe that drew people to her. I willingly opened my heart to her even though she was an Infected. As for Dr. Kal'tsit, I didn't see her often, but every decision she made was convincing.
There's a big Feline who only knows how to shed blood everywhere. The two of us just went rampaging through some woods I'd never seen before.
There was Phidia who didn't talk much and whom I only met briefly. Also, there was a white Cautus, whose icy aura dissuaded me from approaching.
I knew that my mother was on the verge of a mental breakdown, perhaps already past the breaking point... In any case, she was not completely lucid.
But still, she entrusted me to Rhodes Island.
Countless times, I've wondered how I would have turned out if she had left me somewhere else, probably a place without the Infected.
However, right now, as I gaze into those indistinct eyes, I see a light in them that always flickers but has never gone out.
